snippet.title: Game of Thrones episode four leaks online before TV broadcast
snippet.content:
Game of Thrones Season 7, episode four, has been leaked to the public. Picture: HBO.
Staff writersNews Corp Australia Network
Share
THE latest episode of "Game of Thrones" - which is set to air on HBO Sunday night - has reportedly been leaked online after hackers stole data from the network in a recent breach. Episode 4 of Season 7 appears to be authentic, The episode entitled "The Spoils of War," appeared on the subreddit r/freefolk, a popular Game of Thrones discussion board that is not moderated. Reddit user posted it earlyon Friday morning and said in the comments that it was a "Gift from Pakistan." HBO released sent out an internal email to employees addressing the hack on Thursday. "We do not believe that our email system as a whole has been compromised," CEO Richard Plepler wrote. He added that a review continues, and said HBO is hiring an outside firm to help employees monitor their financial accounts. On Tuesday, a company called IP-Echelon filed a report with Google on behalf of HBO, noting that the named website "shares thousands of Home Box Office (HBO) internal company documents," reports the Daily News. IP-Echelon Pty Ltd. regularly files such copyright-infringement notices on behalf of large media entertainment companies, including HBO.
